There are $n$ types of geometric figures. Each type $i$ has $k_i$ figures and a cost of $c_i$ points per figure.  

The factor value starts at 1 and increases to $i+1$ after every $p_i$ figures are destroyed.

Find the maximum number of points that can be earned by destroying all the figures. 

**Input:**

* The first line contains $n$ (the number of figure types).
* Each of the following $n$ lines contains two integers: $k_i$ (number of figures of type $i$) and $c_i$ (cost of one figure of type $i$).
* The next line contains $t$ (the number of factor changes).
* The next line contains $t$ integers: $p_1$, $p_2$, ..., $p_t$ (the number of figures after which the factor changes).

**Output:**

* Print the maximum number of points that can be earned.

You are given a list of items, each with a quantity and a value.  The value of an item increases based on a counter that increments after a certain number of items are collected.  Find the maximum total value you can get by collecting all the items in an optimal order.
